page.title: 07LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: St. Peter's Church, Wrestlingworth was built in the 12th century. It is built on a hill and can be seen for miles around. It is built from flint and local stone. Unfortunately it needs repairs urgently. The village hopes to raise Â£24,000 for repairs to the roof and tower which is crumbling away. John Wesley once preached in the church. He reproached the congregation for their sins so much, that fifteen of them fainted. The church has a lepers window where lepers could receive Communion from outside the church. A stone window has graffiti, done by a crusador.
